description.narrative: IFC anticipates the project to increase access to equity alongside operational value add for startups across Africa. Access to venture capital in Africa remains low compared to most other emerging markets. The project is also expected to increase innovation in key markets across Africa through the support of market-disrupting digital business models. In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market players, innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a market by pushing traditional players to innovate and introduce digital solutions or reduce traditional incumbents market share. IFC anticipates the Fund Manager, raising a second Africa focused fund, significantly larger in size than the first one and having successfully invested in highly disruptive companies with Fund I, will demonstrate the viability venture capital in Africa. This is expected to attract more investors and incentivize more entrepreneurs to start businesses.

Partech Africa Fund II (PAF II or the Fund) is an early-stage venture capital fund focused on businesses in the technology sector in Africa. The fund will invest in Seed to Series D rounds, and follow-on rounds in top portfolio companies.

mailing-address.narrative: Partech Partners SAS Emmanuel Delaveau General Partner Investors Relations +33 1 53 65 65 53 edelaveau@partechpartners.com 33 Rue du Mail, 75002, Paris www.partechpartners.com

name.narrative: The Partech Africa team has local presence in Dakar, Nairobi, Dubai, and Paris.
